urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
We have downgraded the Servere Flood Warning on the River Dee at #Fardon to a Flood Warning.

Although an improving picture, we encourage everyone to remain vigilant and keep a check on our #Flood warnings page https://t.co/znM5bbWfPZ https://t.co/sUjdKxS3Jb

We use ultra high volume pumps #uHVP to help keep communities safe. Here‚Äôs @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installing three in a night time operation. The amount of water to move when there‚Äôs risk of #flooding is huge. These pumps can shift 1 tonne of water every second. https://t.co/aKPiCwvc7j

tweets.text: Flood levels are dropping in #York on #RiverOuse and #RiverFoss but remain high. Stay safe and ensure you don't walk, cycle or drive through flood water @CityofYork https://t.co/L238YxoOup

Drone footage of #Ironbridge this morning shows huge amounts of water moving through with defences operating to protect the community there. Levels remain high along the Severn and many other rivers across #Midlands. EA teams operating 24/7 to respond https://t.co/4ECDXDeMYI https://t.co/n2ddvxA4RP

We've been working 24/7 with our partners to reduce the risk of flooding across Yorkshire after #stormchristoph. This is some of the work we've done so far. Keep up to date with Flood Warnings by visiting https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/Wfo3BlHwnn

tweets.text: THANK YOU from @keanedunk Council Leader #Ryedale - Message to @EnvAgency @NorthYorksFire @RyedaleDC @scarrescue and volunteers who helped save #Norton and #Malton from serious flooding  https://t.co/q2cZfYj383 https://t.co/5HASUF5qZ7
@amy_flanagandy @derbyshiredales @EnvAgencyMids @amy_flanagandy Sure - you should be able to DM us now. Thanks
@ECR59 @RussellB1ggs @EnvAgencyAnglia @The_WMA @N_Rivers_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey Who is the farmer?

As river levels start to drop we've removed #floodwarnings for #RiverSwale at Helperby & Thornton Bridge & the #floodalert for #RiverWiske. A flood alert remains in place on #RiverSwale. There are 18 #floodwarnings across Yorkshire & we continue to monitor levels. https://t.co/fy5yYvvrYW

Stunning walk this morning along the Rib Valley until I came across this. Left wondering if the news today on @Dunne4Ludlow ‚Äòs PMB and @EnvAgency response will make any difference and on what timescale for this rare chalk stream https://t.co/IPolBoStUW

tweets.text: We have deployed a number of pumps in and around Malton and Norton to protect the community from flooding, working with @RyedaleDC @northyorkscc & @YorkshireWater to mange and alleviate flooding. Stay #floodaware https://t.co/4duBrDlDPe

tweets.text:
In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

tweets.text: A massive THANK YOU to all involved in working to protect our towns from flooding. Decisive action in face of the emergency has been able to prevent the significant and widespread damage feared. A big well done to staff from @RyedaleDC, @NorthYorksFire and @EnvAgencyYNE. (1/4) https://t.co/d0CmAhhTjn
Isn't it about time the flood defences here were improved to match the fixed barriers on the other side of the bridge? üòë @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/Lu3tYe6hvp

The following pictures show our @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam installing the #uHVP‚Äôs overnight.

These snippets show the scale of the logistical work that goes on (often out of sight) keeping communities safe and responding to #incidents https://t.co/pWMin0XsOT

tweets.text: With all Flood Risk Management agencies stretched at this time, we are assisting @EnvAgencyYNE with the operation of the Market Weighton Canal ship lock, to reduce water levels across the catchment. https://t.co/ov4xOj0qVL

Excellent work,. @PJennings88   keep the heat on them. It's obscene how unaccountable and untouchable HS2 seems to be, and the apparent complicity of @EnvAgency in turning a blind eye is a nauseating betrayal of their raison d'√™tre https://t.co/bephm6LrYr

Welcome your thoughts and more importantly action @jamesowild  to hold @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia to account and get the action needed beyond letters. Where is the enforcement action to stop this ongoing pollution??! @Feargal_Sharkey @pow_rebecca @TonyJuniper @EmmaHowardBoyd https://t.co/IE74vBvNGr

tweets.text: We desperately need exclusion zones around chalk streams. This river was pristine and contains almost-locally-extinct crayfish. Now it's dead. https://t.co/B1JUcctZo2

Images from our Geomatics team taken yesterday showing the volume of water in the #Trent floodplain making its way through #Nottingham. The Left Bank Scheme at Victoria Embankment is operating as designed, helping to protect thousands of properties from #flood water https://t.co/gt1lvcIVBe
More of our anti @EnvAgency devastating works. But of course they are servants of the SEvernside industrial park and their demand for zero risk insurance. https://t.co/pSp90N10oX

tweets.text: Todays sewage discharge on the @RiverChess reminds us we have outstanding issues with @EnvAgency on what happened last year & the nonsense they used to disguise events, let's not start the same this year. Call them what they are, un-permitted sewage discharges. Start your meter.
